articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: What Crackdown? Migrant Smuggling Business Adapts, Thrives - The New York Times
articles.description: The heavy-set man swept through a nightclub curtain into the reserved area of a nightclub. In the darkness he agreed to talk about his business: handling the income from smuggling migrants across a 375-mile stretch of the U.S.-Mexico border.
articles.content:
___
A Salvadoran smuggler summarized it this way: To have a safe and efficient trip, you have to pay. And with Guatemalan authorities checking people on buses and thousands of National Guard members deployed across Mexico there are more people to pay.

articles.author: Rick Gladstone
articles.title: Shooting Erupts at Russia’s Spy Agency
articles.description: Russian news reports said up to three people were killed in a shooting inside the reception area of the Federal Security Service headquarters in central Moscow.
articles.content:
A deadly shooting erupted in or near the headquarters of Russias Federal Security Service in central Moscow on Thursday evening, and Russian news reports said up to three people were killed, at least some of them employees of the spy agency.

articles.author: Mike Rubin
articles.title: Terry Riley’s Avant-Garde Sounds Are Still Casting Spells
articles.description: The musician and composer is celebrating his 85th birthday — and his influence on a wide swath of culture — a bit early in Brooklyn.
articles.content: On the recorded version of Rainbow, Riley played all the instrumentation himself, using overdubs to build layers of electric organ, harpsichord, tambourine and an Indian goblet drum called a dumbec. At Pioneer Works, the piece will be performed by younger mus… [+1587 chars]

articles.author: Maria Cramer
articles.title: A Lonely Plea: ‘Anybody Need a Grandma for Christmas?’
articles.description: A woman from Tulsa, Okla., with no place to go for the holidays became a painful reminder of the isolation felt by many older Americans.
articles.content:
It seems like the number of people who come to visit their families is decreasing, and the number of people who never had kids is increasing, Mr. Schoeb said. At some point, the loneliness is coming at you like a train coming down the tracks.

articles.author: Vali R. Nasr and Ali Vaez
articles.title: Talk With Iran Now. Time Is Fleeting
articles.description: The tensions rising between Iran and the United States aren’t a signal that diplomacy will fail. They are a warning that negotiations are a must — and soon.
articles.content: The electoral calendars in the United States and Iran add another layer of complexity. President Trump, increasingly bogged down by impeachment proceedings and his re-election campaign, might be more averse to a political backlash from ordering sanctions reli… [+2590 chars]

articles.author: Keith E. Whittington
articles.title: Trump’s Scary Precedent: Scorning Congress
articles.description: The Ukraine charge gets all the attention, but the article of impeachment about obstruction is just as urgent.
articles.content:
President Trump has just become the third president to be impeached by the House of Representatives. In a largely party-line vote, the House majority has sought to hold the president to account for how he has used the powers of his office.
